metadata.synopsis: AD back and forth between Jaheira's Son and Daughter when they're unaware that Jaheira is returning
metadata.how_to_trigger: - Go into Jaheira's house without Jaheira- Watch and wait

3.speaker: Rion
3.text: Where's the boy got to, Jord?
3.context: NodeContext: Wry - emphasis on 'the boy' is in response to Rion calling the youngest child that instead of his name. 'The girls' is an echo of that stress

6.speaker: Jord
6.text: The boy is upstairs. The girls were a little rough in their play earlier.
6.context: NodeContext: Wry - emphasis on 'the boy' is in response to Rion calling the youngest child that instead of his name. 'The girls' is an echo of that stress

5.speaker: Rion
5.text: Chauntea's cheeks, I told them to give him space. That's two volunteers for dishes later, then.
5.context: NodeContext: Dark foreboding - the girls are in trouble

11.speaker: Jord
11.text: Telk says they shut the Church of Last Hope down.
11.context: NodeContext: Snorting, derisive of this friend of the family

10.speaker: Rion
10.text: And how did Telk see that, through the bottom of her drinking mug?
10.context: NodeContext: Snorting, derisive of this friend of the family

8.speaker: Jord
8.text: She was stone cold sober. Heard it from Mother Aramina herself - the Steel Watch said they were only 'encouraging the refugees into an unlawful gathering'.
8.context: NodeContext: Grim humour, passing on stories from the city to his sister

0.speaker: Rion
0.text: Aye. A warm meal and a scrap of rags to sleep on must be very encouraging. Well, the mother knows -
0.context: NodeContext: Sarcastic - what little the refugees were being offered was hardly reason to shut the shelter down

7.speaker: Jord
7.text: That we have space to spare if she needs it. Aye, I passed it on.
7.context: NodeContext: Smoothly reassuring, cutting his sister off - she doesn't need to worry, he already passed on what she was going to ask.

13.speaker: Rion
13.text: Throw some cabbage on your list for the market, Jord.
13.context: NodeContext: A little affronted - he's in training as a druid, not fully in his power yet

9.speaker: Jord
9.text: You know I could just grow it myself. Even a lowly apprentice can manage that much.
9.context: NodeContext: A little affronted - he's in training as a druid, not fully in his power yet

12.speaker: Rion
12.text: I know you can, brother. Just being careful - don't want the young ones going all weird from eating mystical greens.
12.context: NodeContext: Tone is 'hey, I mean no offense'

1.speaker: Jord
1.context: NodeContext: Now very affronted - his sister has implied his magically cultivated food would poison the kids

2.speaker: Rion
2.context: NodeContext: Shrugging - using the youngest of their siblings as an example of how the kids are weird. Just her name alone is argument enough.

4.speaker: Jord
4.context: NodeContext: Anger dissipating into immediate agreement - Fig IS weird
